jd: From: Jay, Brillius jay.s@brillius.com Reply to: jay.s@brillius.com Work authorization: any (candidate must be authorized to work in US)Must-have skills: 3+y as SQL DBA; SSIS,SSAS; Data Definition Language (DDL)Location: Charleston, WV PLEASE SEND LOCAL CANDIDATES ONLY (registered and currently located in Charleston, WV).Candidates from other locations won’t be considered. Relocation is not acceptableRate: please send resumes of your consultants along with the minimum rate they will accept to take (and stay) on the job. The rate is OPEN.Seniority on the skill/s required on this requirement: Mid.Earliest Start Date: ASAPType: Temporary ProjectEstimated Duration: 12 months with possible extension​(s)Additional information: The candidate should be able to provide an ID if the interview is requested. The candidate interviewing must be the same individual who will be assigned to work with our client. Requirements:• Availability to work 100% of the time at the Client’s site in Charleston, WV (required);• Experience with SQL Server 2008 and higher including experience in T-SQL (3+years);• Experience in creation databases, backup and recovery in SQL Server (3+ years);• Experience migrating prior versions of SQL server to SQL Server 12 on Windows servers including conversion of DTS packages to SSIS (2+ years);• Experience installing SSIS and SSAS for SQL server 2008 (2+ years);• Experience in command line DDL operations and scripting (2+ years).Responsibilities include but are not limited to the following:• Develop and manage SQL Server databases, including T-SQL programming;• Create and implement backup and recovery strategies for SQL Server databases;• Migrate databases from previous SQL Server versions to SQL Server 12, including converting DTS packages to SSIS;• Install and configure SQL Server Integration Services (SSIS) and SQL Server Analysis Services (SSAS);• Perform command line DDL operations and scripting for database management;• Monitor and optimize database performance and efficiency;• Implement security measures and best practices for SQL Server databases.
